result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarahlee R. Vue

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on November 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

4:00 p.m.
Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 22CF50 and 22CF1019.

State appears by ADA Hannah Runde; Defendant appears in person, with Attorney David Christian.

Date and time set for a Plea Hearing on 22CF1019. Other file tracking. VRCW.

On 22CF1019:
Waiver of Prelim. filed; COURT questions deft as to waiver.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information will be e-filed; Reading Waived; R/J. 

On 22CF1019:
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to:
COUNT 2: Bail Jumping - Felony, Repeater >> DRI.
COUNT 3: Possess Drug Paraphernalia, Repeater >> DRI.

COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to: 
COUNT 1: Possession of Methamphetamine, Repeater >> NO CONTEST.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: AMENDS PSI ordered in 22CF50 to include 22CF1019. PSI to be completed by 11/11/22.

NEXT DATE >>
Sentencing Hearing - 11/28/22 at 2:30 p.m. (1 hr)

ADJ: 4:20 p.m.
Calendar call on September 8, 2022 at 08:05 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Sarahlee R. Vue
Current: 170828 County Road Z, Ringle, WI 54471 United States  (Effective: 08-18-2022)
Prior: 320 Mobile Ave, Wausau, WI 54403

3:32 p.m.
Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 22CF50, 22CF436, and 22CF602

State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck; Defendant appears in person with Attorney David Christian.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to: 
22CF436
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping - Felony, Repeater >> DRI.
COUNT 2: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), Repeater >> DRI.

22CF602
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping - Felony, Repeater >> DRI.
COUNT 2: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), Repeater >> DRI.

Uncharged OAR >> DRI.

COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to: 
22CF50
COUNT 1: Burglary - Building or Dwelling, Repeater, PTAC >> GUILTY.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: PSI. PSI to be completed 10 days (October 7th) before the Sentencing Hearing. 

NEXT DATE >>
Previously calendared - Sentencing - 10/17/22 at 2:00 p.m. (1 hr)

Adj: 3:46 p.m.

Plea hearing on July 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on October 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Includes 22CF50, 22CF436, 22CF602
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck; Attorney Christian appears by phone; Defendant excused
DATES:
Plea (Order PSI): July 28, 2022 at 3:30 pm
Sentencing: October 17, 2022 at 2:00 pm
Pre-trial conference on June 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Clerk: Nikki.
Case Called: 10:01am.
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck; Defendant appears in person and with Atty David Christian.
VRCW.

Atty Christian has received offer from the State; makes statements re: contact and discussion with deft.
ADA Boeck notes deft has a new file and requests hearing be after initial appearance so cases can track together.

DATES:
PTC w/JA: 6/7 @9:30am (Atty Christian to phone in, deft is excused).

Adjourned: 10:05am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on April 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Probable Cause Found

Clerk: Nikki
Case Called: 9:30am.
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck. Defendant appears via Zoom video and with Atty David Christian in person.

OTR while waiting for Officer: 9:32am.

Case Recalled: 9:54am.

Parties stipulate to identity of defendant.
Jessica Allen sworn and testifies.

Waiver of Prelim filed.
Court questions Defendant as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.

COURT finds probable cause. Defendant bound over for arraignment and trial.
Information to be e-filed. R/W; R/J.

PLEA>> NOT GUILTY.

DATES:
JPTC/TPD: 4/14/22 @10:00am.

Bond continues.

Adjourned: 10:04am.
Preliminary Hearing on February 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ADA Hannah Boeck appears in person; Attorney David Christian appears by telephone; Defendant in treatment and excused
Next date >> Prelim 2/17/22 at 9:30 am - Defendant and Counsel may appear via ZOOM; JPTC 3/24/22 at 9:30 am

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s):  T.F.L., N.J., and N.M.L. or victim's residence.   Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.    Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.
